meanings.definition: Having a tendency to peck or pick at something.
meanings.sent1: The peckier bird kept searching for seeds in the grass.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the peckier chickens were always the first to find the treats.
meanings.sent3: The peckier squirrel was determined to crack open every nut in the yard.
meanings.sent4: His peckier nature made him the perfect candidate for the job of taste tester.
meanings.sent5: The peckier cat would spend hours trying to catch the elusive laser pointer dot.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more inclined to peck or pick at something.
meanings.sent1: The smaller bird was peckier than its larger companion.
meanings.sent2: As the competition heated up, she became even peckier in her critiques.
meanings.sent3: The peckier child insisted on trying every flavor of ice cream before choosing.
meanings.sent4: Her peckier attitude towards details helped her excel in her job as a proofreader.
meanings.sent5: The peckier puppy eagerly searched for the tastiest bone in the yard.
